section.para: This function allows you to inquire on cheques issued against accounts they have authority to use. You can also request for new cheque books through "Request Cheque Book" option.

section.title: Cheque Services Landing Page
section.para:
The Cheques Landing page displays a list of cheque book requests made by the user that in various stages of their life cycle. The requests are displayed in multiple tabs based on the current status of request. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.
You can customise the list of columns displayed through SDK.
The following image illustrates the cheque services landing page:

listitem.para: Use this option to view the status of cheque issued by the entity for the selected account number.
Use this option to stop the cheque request.
Use this option to initiate a new request for Cheque Book. Enter the details like account for which cheque book is required, number of cheque books and delivery mode to submit the request.

section.para:
The cheque listing page segregates Cheque Book requests based on their current status like draft, awaiting response from client or bank, completed and rejected from bank.The following ribbon items enable you to perform various actions on individual transaction or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Tab
Description
Draft
Lists all the cheques that are in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement.
Draft tab is available only to maker user.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing cheque book requests that are awaiting client approval from a second user within the corporate.
The Approve and Return action items are available only for a checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple requests to 'Approve' or 'Return' though the checkbox provided for every request listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing cheque requests that are awaiting bank approval.
Completed
Lists all the completed cheque book requests.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected cheque book requests by the bank. The status given to such records is "Not Processed".

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Entity, Account Number. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant cheque requests. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched. You can also save filter preference by clicking on Save as New View and enter the name of new view, you may also select "Make Preference as Default" to set the default preference to newly created view.

You can perform the following actions on the listed cheque requests:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of transactions.
CSV Download: Download the list of transactions displayed on the dashboard.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed transactions.
Customize: You can customize the order in which the cheque book request information is displayed. You can achieve following customizations through this feature:
Select the columns that you wish to display, unselect the column names to hide the columns.
Click on lock icon to freeze the position of the column. The freezed columns are placed on the left of screen. You can freeze a maximum of three columns.
You can drag and drop a column name to rearrange the table columns. Hover over multiple dots icon against each column name to, a hand icon appears, which suggests that the column is ready to be dragged and dropped.
This feature is available for all the tables of Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.title: Information on Actions
section.para: This section describes all the actions that you can perform on listed transactions. The actions are available in relevant tabs based on the ribbon you are on.

listitem.para: Actions are based on the user persona, like a maker user will have the action Edit (update an existing transaction), View (view the details of the individual transactions), Details (view the full details of the transactions), Discard (delete an existing draft transaction).

section.title: Transaction Details
section.para: This section describes the information presented on clicking the details button against any given transaction:

entry.para: Field
Description

Displays the cheque book request details. The information is spread over two tabs which are described below:
Transaction Details: Displays the details of the cheque book request transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab opens details in read-only mode.

You can perform following actions on the opened transactions:
